text: hey guys Poconos my stay here with how
two men those who've been following me
for a while know that I've used an
Android device pretty much all my life
ten years to be exact and I've never had

that I've ever owned in an iPad 3 and
even though it's stuck on iOS 9 it
performs well and I'm still using it
till this day since the iPad gave me
such a great experience I wondered if
the iPhone 10s would - I was curious to
find out why some people have stuck with
the iPhone for so long is iOS that much
better than stock Android has
customization improved over the years
I was curious what advantages and
disadvantages you get from purchasing
apples $1000 flagship after using the
10s furry little over two weeks I'm
pretty confident that I've got in all my

change if I decided to use the phone for

straight into Apple's ecosystem but for
now this is my overall impression of the
iPhone 10s this video is a bit lengthy
so I'll include timestamps in the
description to jump around different
sections starting with the design I've
always known that Apple does an amazing
job with almost all their products maybe
with a few exceptions so I wasn't
surprised to find that the iPhone 10's
was a gorgeous looking smartphone with a
premium feel the stainless steel frame
gave the phone a hefty weight the glass
front back and curved edges provide a
smooth feel the buttons are perfectly
placed and very tactile and the gold
color gives it that hypebeast look to
let everyone know that you dropped $1000
on your smart phone I mean just being
real here I also enjoyed the overall
size of the device it was the perfect
choice for one-handed use my thumb could
easily reach each corner without
hesitation and the edge to edge display
didn't make me feel like I was
sacrificing any screen real estate with
the 10s max you can't expect even more
pixels but it's not going to be as
friendly to use with one hand the only
thing that didn't like about the design
was the camera bump overly sized notch
and the missing headphone jack of course

say it with me D brand they just

which looks absolutely amazing on the

so I'll drop a link right below that

another thing I like about the 10s is
the display even though the resolution

looks sharp and detailed videos look

the display is in quad HD
I guess he's Super AMOLED panel with a
great PPI really does wonders even at
low resolutions I also appreciated a
force touch sure it's one of those
things that you'll tend to show off more
than actually use cuz no the smartphone
competitor has a similar hardware

action you want to tap on for example in

screen long press to bring up the menu
and with apples forced touch I can also
press down on the screen to quickly
preview the tweet that was retweeted and
press down even harder if I want to open
the retweeted tweet within its own page
that's something you can't do on Android
now for the juicy part i OS 12 gave me a
rollercoaster of emotions there are so
many minor details about Apple software
that I love and hate but for the sake of
time I'll just stick with the ones that
stood out the most let's start with the
launcher we've all seen what it looks
like and how it works it's just all your
installed apps spread throughout various
pages the leftmost screen is your
widgets page which you can customize to
your likings force pressing an app will
bring up its quick shortcuts and widgets
and a swipe down will bring up a
universal search engine with amazing
integration for all your apps web
searches and shortcuts you can also
delete apps straight from the home
screen which I dig create folders and
move apps around but that's it you
literally cannot customize anything else
about the home screen except simple
stuff like wallpaper or you've been
using third-party launcher which is sad
after ten years I thought Apple would
give their users a bit more freedom for
clarification you can't change the grid
size you can only have four apps in the
dock there is no I compact support you
can't move screens around you can't play
shortcuts or widgets on any screen
besides the leftmost screen and so forth
I'm also not a big fan of the
organization if you're going to make
your stock launcher just a couple of
pages filled with apps then at least let
me categorize the apps automatically in
a way that makes sense to me like
alphabetical order when I download an
app I don't want it to automatically
show up on the last page I wanted to be
alphabetized lastly in the widgets panel
I don't like that you can't see a
preview of the widget before placing it
on the panel I have to add the widget to
the panel to be able to see what it even
looks like that's kind of annoying
especially considering that I have over
30 widget names to choose from moving on
to a more positive note iOS has a strong
community of third-party app developers
since there aren't that many iPhone
models out there especially when
compared to Android devices app
developers in iOS don't have a hard time
making their apps compatible so it's
really rare to find a third-party app
that is extremely buggy or doesn't work
with your phone you also get a few more
amazing apps that Android doesn't have
such as vellum which is by far the best
wallpaper app I have ever used shortcuts
to create quick shortcuts such as
flipping a coin combining screenshots
calculating a tip quickly enabling
battery saver and more dive inside which
is a fun game to explore the depths of
the ocean delivery's is an all-in-one
package tracking app for various
services such as UPS USPS FedEx DHL and
more but of course I missed quite a few
apps from android such as really for
reddit which is by far the best read app
I have ever used Google apps such as
Matt's and YouTube feel a bit outdated
on iOS and are missing a few features
from Android stop ad gets rid of ads and
a few more indie apps speaking of apps
let's talk about everyone's favorite one
on iOS iMessage this application is one
of the main reasons why many people
don't switch to Android especially in
the u.s. it's like joining an exclusive
group and then having a hard time
leaving it when you message other iPhone
users those conversations get special
benefits for example you can see when
the other person is typing and when they
seen your message their support for
high-quality photos you can play games
with each other
send payments with Apple pay send an
emoji or me emoji for laughter send
messages with cool looking effects my
favorite feature and more plus if you
have a Mac you can experience cross
device integration with iMessage
straight from your computer sure this is
basic stuff for those who use whatsapp
or even Facebook Messenger but you need
to understand that many people in the
u.s. use iMessage and those that don't
aka Android users tend to use SMS
because of all those iMessage users out
there it's mostly a u.s. problem so in
my opinion iMessage is a great mess
with extra benefits if you message other
people with an iPhone but I have read a
couple articles that iMessage can cause
some problems when switching back to
Android my good friend David Roddick
over at Andrew police said in his review
of the iPhone 10 that some of his
contacts may have sent him messages
after he switched back to Android which
he never received his conclusion was the
iMessage for all its benefits is
probably Apple abusing its power over an
ecosystem at very worst personally I'm
not a huge voice assistant user to begin
with so when switching a Syrian though I
did notice to step down in quality from
Google Assistant I wasn't really
bothered by the robotic simple phrased
voice all I need from Siri was a quick
way to set a timer do some quick math
get the weather forecast remotely
control my Spotify music and maybe tell
me a quick joke simple stuff however
with the addition of shortcuts a new app
recently introduced in iOS 12 I was
really astonished that you could create
your own voice commands to do a variety
of tasks this is something that you can
do with Google Assistant however it's
not as versatile here's a few examples
of what I was able to accomplish get the
Wi-Fi QR code search Amazon
combined screenshots ASCII clipboard
plus the ability to hot word Siri even
when the phone is locked was a nice
addition if I were to compare Google
assistant to Siri I would say that
Google assistant does a way better job
at handling simple commands and
questions with a more natural sounding
tone plus Google's version can enter way
more voice interaction to feel like more
like a conversation and it outputs it
answers a slight second faster than Siri
still Siri was very useful and did most
of the things I asked for just fine I
really enjoyed using the gesture
navigation bar I wasn't expecting it to
be this good or that I would get used to
it so quickly since I've been using a
three button nav bar pretty much all my
life but it turned out to be quite the
opposite swiping up to go the home
screen or swiping up and long pressing
in the middle to go to my recently used
apps felt more intuitive plus the bar
never gets in the way gives me a lot of
screen action and the transition
animations are perfect it's something
that Android can't seem to compete with
on the same level when I switch back to
Android this is definitely one of the
main features I'm going to miss moving
on and one of the things that everyone
hated in iOS was the notifications there
was no bundling of notifications it was
harder to turn off notifications very
specific app and clearing each
notification was a multi-step process
seemed like hell but with iOS 12 I can
tell that it has gotten way better
notifications are not bundled so your
lockscreen doesn't look like your
Twitter feed you can manage a
notification straight from the lock
screen to turn them off completely or
deliver them quietly which means
notifications for your specific app will
only appear in your notification center
and not your lockscreen perfect for apps
that won't deliver any important
notifications and I love how only your
new notifications will appear in the
lockscreen old notifications that you
haven't open or dismissed will only
appear when you swipe up on your lock
screen or in your Notification Center
so yeah notifications on iOS are great
but there's still a few things I would
change first to dismiss a notification
you need to swipe it twice that's
annoying and second some notifications
are just too big and take up a lot of
space
apples include emails or long messages I
would rather see the increased
information when I force touch it
jumping into the settings I noticed that
Apple likes to keep everything simple
and upfront which I enjoy the first set
of menus is for connections the second
set is for notification management the
third set is for general settings such
as managing features like Siri control
center face ID the display settings and
more and the rest is application
management now I'm not going to go
through every single feature within the
settings but I do want to talk about two
menus that stood out to me screen time
and battery screen time was just
introduced in iOS 12 it's a great way to
know what you do the most when you're on
your iPhone and how to limit yourself so
you don't use it too much for me I spend
most of my time with social networking
more specifically texting and social
media so if I want to limit myself and
become more productive I can restrict
the amount of time that I use the apps
that are categorized as social
networking so now I can't use Instagram
or Twitter for more than two hours per
day there's also a feature called
downtime which lets you block all your
apps from being used for your cent
amount of time this is perfect for the
nighttime side don't accidentally stay
up til 2:00 a.m. watching Android police
videos yeah obviously this feature isn't
something we haven't seen before but I'm
always glad when a manufacturer makes it
useful and popular app idea into
something native the battery menu within
iOS is another feature that Apple has
done better than Android Android Pi only
keeps track of your battery usage since
the last full charge and then resets
with no long-term history iOS on the
other hand keeps track of the battery
usage from the last 10 days for each day
I can see the screen on and off time app
battery usage and the average data from
all 10 days within the 24 hour section I
can see what apps I use at a specific
time
along with background activity lastly I
love that Apple lets you know that you
have a damaged or used up physical
battery with battery health currently my
health is at 100% but over time that
percentage will lower as cycle counts
build up and I'll know what to
physically replace my battery while
we're in this menu I guess I'll show off
how well the battery life was on the 10
s from my data I got a screen on time
average of around 6 hours and 25 minutes
which is extremely good there aren't
that many phones out there nowadays that
can last that long and
my battery usage by application you can
see that I use my phone in a pretty
basic way social apps Spotify and I
messages and this is where Bluetooth and
Wi-Fi enabled at all times plus the
standby time was amazing if I forgot to
charge it overnight then I can still use
it in the morning from where I left off
the only thing that sucks about the
iPhones battery is that charging it is a

phone doesn't have any fast charging
mechanism it literally takes hours to
charge it back up to a hundred percent
also I hate the fact that Apple has to
have their own special charging port and
can't just use the USB type-c like the

that comes with the phone is only around
three feet long
like why taking a look at face ID this
is Apple's only biometric security
method on the 10 s and the main reason
why the notch at the top is so big
security wise face ID is extremely good
with all the sensors at the top to
verify the structure of your face it's
really hard to fool this thing the
unlocking speed however isn't bad but
it's also not great I do find it
annoying that I need to stare directly
into the phone to unlock it and
sometimes usually at night it takes a
few extra tries to unlock for comparison
the one plus six is face unlock feature
can unlock way faster but it's not as
secure I still prefer the fingerprint
sensors so hopefully in the future Apple
can choose to go with an in display one
I was very satisfied with the rear
cameras pictures had plenty of details
colors look very natural and accurate
thanks to smart HDR and photos were
captured almost instantly for low-light
and nighttime shots it also produced
nice and clear images for key videos at
60fps looked amazing and had great
stabilization thanks to OIS the camera
never gave me any problems when I needed
it it came through it's not as good as
the pixel tube but it's really close I
also enjoyed Apple's live effect to show
when a picture was taken kind of a
useless feature but it's still nice to
have in Apple's keynote event they made
a huge deal about a new camera feature
where you can control the artificial
bokeh effect within a picture taking in
portrait mode after the fact in other
words after I take a portrait I could
then change the dynamic depth of field
from anywhere between at 1.4 to f-16 it
works extremely well and keeps the edges
of the subject sharp the only Android
smartphones that have a similar feature
are Samson
which have a feature called life focus
but it doesn't work as well what I did
find to be weird is that the front
facing camera beautified my face just a
bit by default it made my skin look a
lot smoother and got rid of a few
wrinkles the results were clear when I
compared a 10s selfie with and Andrews
flagship such as the one plus six people
are calling this beauty gate I don't
mind it too much since it's not an
excessive feature but I do have to
remind myself that I don't actually look
that good in real life Thank You Apple
probably the best feature of the iPhone
10s is the performance this is by far
the most fluid smart phone I have ever
used
animations are buttery smooth everything
loads up quickly and it's the perfect
phone for amazing gaming performance of
course this is due to Apple's new chip

a 45 chipset I compare the 10s to the 1
plus 6 since I believe that's the
fastest Android phone out right now and
my results buried when opening apps both
phones had similar timings but it's
pretty obvious that oneplus and Android
in general has an increased scale and

make the device look a bit faster for
example with the same swipe force on the
1 + 6 + Twitter or Instagram I was able

the 10s what I am certain about is that
the iPhone is way more fluid and
smoother than the 1 plus 6 for those
wanting to see technical results I ran

iPhone 10s came out on top but don't
take it the wrong way both ones are
extremely fast and the difference in
real-world performance isn't enormous in
my opinion lastly I wanted to do a
speedrun of some of the things I liked
and didn't like about the 10s starting

I don't want to pull out my phone to me
the device I appreciate is ip68 water

wireless charging and the option to

fortune features that I don't like and

doesn't have an LED light or an being
displace so I never know when

I wish the 10s had a bit more RAM as I

there's no way to clear all the apps at

offline maps feature I have to have the

anyways that's everything I think about
